parameters module¶

Different parametrizations of QAOA circuits.

Description¶

This module holds an abstract class to store QAOA parameters in and (so far) four derived classes that allow for more or less degrees of freedom in the QAOA Ansätze

class qaoa.parameters.AbstractQAOAParameters(constant_parameters, variable_parameters=None)¶

Bases: object

An abstract class to hold the parameters of a QAOA run and compute the angles from them.

Parameters

  • constant_parameters (Any) – The constant parameters like the hamiltonian or number of steps. More in set_constant_parameters()

  • variable_parameters (Any) – The variable parameters like the angles or stepwidths. More details in update_variable_parameters()

__init__(constant_parameters, variable_parameters=None)¶

Sets all the constant parameters via self.set_constant_parameters() and variable parameters via self.update_variable_parameters

classmethod from_hamiltonian(cost_hamiltonian, timesteps, time=None, reg=None)¶

Calculate initial parameters from a hamiltonian corresponding to a linear ramp annealing schedule.

Parameters

  • cost_hamiltonian (PauliSum) – cost_hamiltonian for which to calcuate the initial QAOA parameters.

  • reg (List) – (Optional) Register of qubits on which cost_hamiltonian acts. If None is passed, cost_hamiltonian.get_qubits() is used.

  • timesteps (int) – Number of timesteps.

  • time (float) – Total annealing time. If none is passed, 0,7 * timesteps is used.

Returns

The initial parameters best for cost_hamiltonian.

Return type

AbstractQAOAParameters

plot(ax=None)¶

Plots itself to the canvas ax, if provided

Parameters

ax (matplotlib.axes._subplots.AxesSubplot) – The canvas to plot itself on

raw()¶

Returns the angles in a 1D array. This is needed by scipy.optimize.minimize which only minimizes w.r.t a 1D array of parameters

Returns

all the tunable parameters in a 1D array. Has the same output format as the expected input of self.update

Return type

np.array

raw_all()¶

Returns all single rotation angles as needed for the memory map in parametric circuits

Returns

Returns all single rotation angles in the ordering (betas, gamma_singles, gammas_pairs) where betas = (beta_q0_t0, beta_q1_t0, … , beta_qn_tp) and the same for gammas_singles and gammas_pairs

Return type

Union[List, np.array]

set_constant_parameters(constant_parameters)¶

sets the constant parameters, like the register for the x-rotations and qubit lists for the single and double qubit z-rotation. Must initialize - self.reg the register to apply the x rotations on - self.qubits_singles the list of qubits to apply the single qubit

z rotations on

  • self.qubits_pairs the list of qubits to apply the double qubit z rotations on

  • self.timesteps the number of timesteps

update(new_values)¶

Updates all the angles based on a 1D array whose shape is specified later. The input has the same format as the output of self.raw(). This is useful for scipy.optimize.minimize which only minimizes w.r.t a 1D array of parameters

Parameters

new_values (Union[list, np.array]) – A 1D array with the new parameters. Must have length len(self)

update_variable_parameters(variable_parameters)¶

Updates the variable parameters (i.e. angle parameters) s.t. - self.betas is a list/array of the x-rotation angles.

Must have dim self.timesteps x len(self.reg)

  • self.gammas_singles is the list of the single qubit Z-rotation angles.

    Must have dim dim self.timesteps x len(self.qubits_singles)

  • self.gammas_pairs is the list of the two qubit Z-rotation angles.

    Must have dim dim self.timesteps x len(self.qubits_pairs)

class qaoa.parameters.AdiabaticTimestepsQAOAParameters(constant_parameters, variable_parameters=None)¶

Bases: qaoa.parameters.AbstractQAOAParameters

QAOA parameters that implement U = exp(-i*(T-t_f)H_0)exp(-i*t_f*H_c) … exp(-i*(T-t_0)H_0)exp(-i*t_0*H_c) and only vary the t_i

classmethod from_hamiltonian(cost_hamiltonian, timesteps, time=None, reg=None)¶
Returns

  • rtype: AlternatingOperatorsQAOAParameters

  • A AlternatingOperatorsQAOAParameters object holding all the

  • parameters

raw()¶

Clearly in this case the new times

set_constant_parameters(constant_parameters)¶
Parameters

constant_parameters (Tuple) – A tuple of the form (reg, qubits_singles, qubits_pairs, hamiltonian, self.time)

update(new_values)¶

Updates all the angles based on a 1D array whose shape is specified later. The input has the same format as the output of self.raw(). This is useful for scipy.optimize.minimize which only minimizes w.r.t a 1D array of parameters

Parameters

new_values (Union[list, np.array]) – A 1D array with the new parameters. Must have length len(self)

update_variable_parameters(variable_parameters=None)¶

Updates the variable parameters (i.e. angle parameters) s.t. - self.betas is a list/array of the x-rotation angles.

Must have dim self.timesteps x len(self.reg)

  • self.gammas_singles is the list of the single qubit Z-rotation angles.

    Must have dim dim self.timesteps x len(self.qubits_singles)

  • self.gammas_pairs is the list of the two qubit Z-rotation angles.

    Must have dim dim self.timesteps x len(self.qubits_pairs)

class qaoa.parameters.AlternatingOperatorsQAOAParameters(constant_parameters, variable_parameters=None)¶

Bases: qaoa.parameters.GeneralQAOAParameters

QAOA parameters that implement exp(-i*beta_f*H_0)*exp(-i*gamma_f*H_c)*… with an arbitrary H_c

  • parameters

set_constant_parameters(constant_parameters)¶

constant_parameters (Tuple) – A tuple of the form (reg, qubits_singles, qubits_pairs, hamiltonian)

update(new_values)¶

Updates all the angles based on a 1D array whose shape is specified later. The input has the same format as the output of self.raw(). This is useful for scipy.optimize.minimize which only minimizes w.r.t a 1D array of parameters

Parameters

new_values (Union[list, np.array]) – A 1D array with the new parameters. Must have length len(self)

update_variable_parameters(variable_parameters=None)¶
Parameters

variable_parameters (Tuple) – a tuple containing (betas, gammas_singles, gammas_pairs) in their fully extended form.

class qaoa.parameters.FourierQAOAParameters(constant_parameters, variable_parameters=None)¶

Bases: qaoa.parameters.AbstractQAOAParameters

The qaoao parameters as the sine/cosine transform of the original gammas and betas. See ()[] for a detailled description

classmethod from_hamiltonian(cost_hamiltonian, timesteps, q=4, time=None, reg=None)¶
Parameters

  • cost_hamiltonian (PauliSum) – The cost hamiltonian

  • timesteps (int) – number of timesteps

  • time (Number) – total time. Set to 0.7*timesteps if None is passed.

  • fourier (q) – Number of Fourier coeffs. Defaults to 4

  • reg (List) – The qubits to apply X-Rotations on

Returns

A AlternatingOperatorsQAOAParameters object holding all the parameters

Return type

rtype: AlternatingOperatorsQAOAParameters

depending on nqubits

Parameters

param variable_parameters: (tuple) a tuple containing (v, -- u_singles, u_pairs)

class qaoa.parameters.GeneralQAOAParameters(constant_parameters, variable_parameters=None)¶

Bases: qaoa.parameters.AbstractQAOAParameters

QAOA parameters in their most general form with different angles for each operator.

classmethod from_hamiltonian(cost_hamiltonian, timesteps, time=None, reg=None)¶

Calculate initial parameters from a hamiltonian corresponding to a linear ramp annealing schedule.

Parameters

  • cost_hamiltonian (PauliSum) – cost_hamiltonian for which to calcuate the initial QAOA parameters.

  • reg (List) – (Optional) Register of qubits on which cost_hamiltonian acts. If None is passed, cost_hamiltonian.get_qubits() is used.

  • timesteps (int) – Number of timesteps.

  • time (float) – Total annealing time. If none is passed, 0,7 * timesteps is used.

Returns

The initial parameters best for cost_hamiltonian.

Return type

AbstractQAOAParameters
